alert.note: Alert for Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 10 at 2:43PM MST until August 10 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Navajo County southwest of Show Low. * WHEN...Until 400 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Dangerous flooding over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 241 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated that the heavy rain has ended, however flooding remains a threat from earlier rainfall. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.25 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Mud Creek, Forestdale Creek, Show Low Creek, Corduroy Creek, Pinedale Wash, Dodson Wash, Hog Wash and Turkey Canyon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Apache Reservation and Lewis Canyon Group Campground. - This includes the following highways... Highway 60 between mile markers 328 and 336. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall. Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
